unnormalised: **EV Charging Gets a Festive Boost Ahead of Onam!**
normalised: E V Charging Gets a Festive Boost Ahead of Onam!

unnormalised: Bangalore – Just in time for the Onam festivities, EV charging infrastructure is getting a major push. Ather Energy announced plans to install fast chargers across key Kochi locations, making that long trip back home for sadhya just a little bit easier.
normalised: Bangalore – Just in time for the Onam festivities, E V charging infrastructure is getting a major push. Ather Energy announced plans to install fast chargers across key Kochi locations, making that long trip back home for sadhya just a little bit easier.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Tata Power is teaming up with local kirana stores in Chennai to offer neighborhood charging points. Imagine grabbing a quick masala chai and charging your Nexon EV simultaneously!
normalised: Meanwhile, Tata Power is teaming up with local kirana stores in Chennai to offer neighborhood charging points. Imagine grabbing a quick masala chai and charging your Nexon E V simultaneously!

unnormalised: Reports suggest a surge in EV sales this quarter, fueled by rising petrol prices and government subsidies. Many are ditching their old petrol scooters for electric alternatives, especially in cities like Delhi and Mumbai.
normalised: Reports suggest a surge in E V sales this quarter, fueled by rising petrol prices and government subsidies. Many are ditching their old petrol scooters for electric alternatives, especially in cities like Delhi and Mumbai.

unnormalised: But some folks are still worried about "range anxiety." Experts suggest that better charging infrastructure and reliable range estimates are key to wider EV adoption. Maybe one day we’ll have charging stations as common as biryani stalls on every corner. Fingers crossed! This move expected to save consumers Rs. 5000-Rs. 10000 per annum, and the chargers are expected to cover 100 km in just 30 minutes of charging.
normalised: But some folks are still worried about "range anxiety." Experts suggest that better charging infrastructure and reliable range estimates are key to wider E V adoption. Maybe one day we’ll have charging stations as common as biryani stalls on every corner. Fingers crossed! This move expected to save consumers rupees five thousand to rupees ten thousand per annum, and the chargers are expected to cover one hundred kilometer in just thirty minutes of charging.

unnormalised: IIT Madras is also working on developing advanced battery technology to further improve range and charging speeds.
normalised: I I T Madras is also working on developing advanced battery technology to further improve range and charging speeds.
